intro: Hyphear lambertianum, commonly known as the Lambertian hyphear, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
